creditline: The Miscellaneous Works of Art Purchase Fund, Anonymous Gift of funds, by exchange
text: In the late eighteenth century, woven textile designs shifted from the large, elaborate patterns of the Rococo style to the more restrained taste of the Neo-Classical style. Sprays of small flowers accompany thin bands of rocaille (shell encrusted or pebbly) motifs, woven with gold and silver, as well as multi-colored threads. This panel may have been part of a furniture fabric for a matched set of chairs and sofas used in an elegant French reception room.
title: Panel
